project.teaser: The European innovation landscape is still geographically unbalanced, negatively affecting more disadvantaged business ecosystems and creating in those areas weaker entrepreneurial activity, scarcer investments and lower employment opportunities. As a consequence, the diverse...
project.objective: The European innovation landscape is still geographically unbalanced, negatively affecting more disadvantaged business ecosystems and creating in those areas weaker entrepreneurial activity, scarcer investments and lower employment opportunities. As a consequence, the diverse innovation landscape in Europe and the strong geographical gap among the better-connected innovation ecosystems (‘strong innovators’ and ‘innovation leaders’) and the less connected ones (‘moderate’ and ‘emerging’), leads the start-ups from better-connected ecosystems benefitting from more local accelerators with greater funding opportunities and more qualified business support services compared to their counterparts elsewhere. Starting from these premises, the mission of the AccelerAction project is to lay the foundations for a reversal trend, by contributing in making moderate and emerging innovation ecosystems more attractive to international companies interested in setting up their businesses outside the established centres and generating a more balanced business activity across Europe. To this end, AccelerAction aims to create more connected and efficient innovation ecosystems in the sector of advanced technologies, supporting the scaling of companies, encouraging innovation and stimulating cooperation among national, regional and local innovation actors through a pan-European Networked Acceleration Programme. These are the AccelerAction objectives in detail: i) improve the quality and outreach of business acceleration services in developing innovation ecosystems; ii) co-design programmes of activities proposed jointly by business acceleration entities located in less connected ecosystems and innovation hubs; iii) strengthening less connected ecosystems to increase their competitiveness & connectivity, and to keep more balanced the business activity across Europe; iv) accelerate gender equality in the innovation ecosystems.
project.title: A pan-European Networked Acceleration Programme to expand acceleration ecosystems and foster the scalability potential of European business
project.keywords: acceleration, innovation ecosystems, gender equality, DeepTech, scaleup, pan-European network

article.title: New pan-European Networked Acceleration Programme connecting different EU innovation ecosystems

result.title: Alliance Generation Plan
result.description: Plan that will define and help enlarge the spectrum of actors involved and boost the creation of a structured and coordinated network of stakeholders from the innovation ecosystem.

result.title: Communication package
result.description: It will re-group set of communication materials developed for the project, such as project logo, visual identity documents, communication templates etc.

result.title: AccelerAction assessment methodology
result.description: This method will define how to assess the gaps & challenges faced by the business acceleration entities located in less connected innovation ecosystems (modest/emerging) and innovation hubs (strong innovators).

result.title: AccelerAction Virtual Ecosystem
result.description: AccelerAction Virtual Ecosystem will have trusted, comprehensive and accessible database of innovation ecosystem stakeholders within the virtual platform. It will allow business entities (accelerators, start-ups, innovation agencies, business networks) and experts (mentors, evaluators, investors, educational institutions and regional authorities) to share good practices, to easily access business support solutions, to find the most suitable potential investor/s and to discover networking opportunities.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - AccelerAction (A pan-European Networked Acceleration Programme to expand acceleration ecosystems and foster the scalability potential of European business)
result.teaser: The European innovation landscape remains geographically unbalanced, with less-connected business ecosystems facing weaker entrepreneurial activity, scarcer investments, and lower employment opportunities. In contrast, startups in better-connected innovation hubs ("strong...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Plan for Communication, Diss. & Exploitation of Results (first release)
result.description: This Plan will be prepared at the beginning of the project and will define dissemination & communication strategy, tools and activities. It will contain also first draft of the exploitation ideas and mapping of the project’s expected results for an appropriate strategy results packaging.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The DMP will describe procedures and criteria that shall be applied by all partners and for all procedures involving external participants in order to set out the ethical requirements that the project must comply with and to set data collection requirements

result.title: Pan-EU Networked Acceleration Programme (EU-NAP)
result.description: The new EU-NAP Programme will be jointly designed by strong and moderate innovators and will be based on the main findings emerged from the discovery process. EU-NAP will be based on a strong complementarity of knowledge, expertise and assets, leading to the co-creation of added value. The innovative startups and SMEs will benefit from the mentoring programmes abroad and scaleup support with the final aim to improve the less connected acceleration ecosystems.

result.title: Main findings on EU-NAP implementation
result.description: The document will describe the main findings emerged from the implementation period, including a set of best practices on how to best use the EU-NAP model to accelerate scaleup of startups and SMEs.TECHC will be supported by BETA-i in the development of the deliverable

result.title: Gender diversity in European DeepTech Accelerator Programmes

details.authors: Vasiliki Brimpou, Achilleas Barlas, Giovanni Zazzerini, Victoria Bellou, Yeoryios Stamboulis
details.journalTitle: ISPIM Connects Osaka – Connecting and Empowering Society
details.publisher: ISPIM - the International Society for Professional Innovation Management

result.title: Policy recommendations for policy makers
result.description: Set of recommendations for policy makers that are located in the moderate/emerging innovative areas, but also in the stronger ones, will be created, in order to guarantee a long term sustainability impact and a legal framework at regional/local level.

result.title: Final Report on Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Activities
result.description: Final Report will describe the dissemination and communication activities made during the project, together with the exploitation activities done and those planned after the official end of the project.

result.title: Policy Recommendations for an Interconnected European DeepTech Ecosystem

details.authors: G. Zazzerini, L. Adinolfi, A. Barlas, V. Bellou, V. Brimpou, Y. Stamboulis
details.journalTitle: LUISS Institute for European Analysis and Policy - Policy Brief 4/2025
details.publisher: LUISS Institute for European Analysis and Policy (LEAP)

result.title: AccelerAction Strategic Discovery Process: main findings
result.description: The report will summarise the main findings emerged during the Round Tables, with a special focus on challenges faced by moderate/emerging accelerators and suggestions on how to expand their innovation potential.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
